image.altText: Matt Canavan, in side profile, grimaces slightly during a press conference

props.synopsis: Queensland senator Matt Canavan will challenge David Littleproud for leadership of the Nationals while Angus Taylor will run against Sussan Ley for the leadership of the Liberal Party. Follow live.

title.children: Nationals leader faces Canavan challenge as Taylor confirms he'll contest Liberal leadership

image.altText: Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: Far from Rome, the sky is thick with portent as Australia's political parties decide who has power in the current parliament.Â

title.children: Australia's political conclave theatrics feel blokey, but the future is female

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial has been played a police interview filmed with her son weeks after a beef Wellington lunch which led to the deaths of three people.

title.children: Erin Patterson was building Lego hours after serving deadly meal, court hears

image.altText: A Philippine Navy AW159 helicopter with the the HMAS Sydney in the background.

props.synopsis: China's Foreign Ministry sharply criticises Australia after joint drills in the South China Sea with the US and the Philippines, accusing all three nations of trying to "create trouble."

title.children: China criticises Australia over joint exercises in South China Sea

image.altText: Police officers in uniform patrolling a street.

props.synopsis: A former employee of Tasmania's notorious Ashley Youth Detention Centre has been arrested over alleged serious sexual offences, including child sexual abuse, while he was working at the centre.

title.children: Fomer employee of notorious Tasmanian children's prison charged over alleged abuse

image.altText: Pope Leo XIV waving on the central loggia of St. Peter's Basilica

props.synopsis: Chicago-born Robert Prevost, now Pope Leo XIV, has been elected as pontiff. Here's what's anticipated from his papacy when it comes to key issues facing the Church.Â

title.children: Where does Pope Leo XIV stand on key issues facing the Catholic Church?

image.altText: Newly elected Pope Leo XIV looks up when appears on the balcony at the Vatican

props.synopsis: He was a close confidant of the previous pontiff, Pope Francis, and we learnt a lot about what he might be planning to do after his brief speech.Â

title.children: In 10 minutes, Pope Leo XIV told us a lot about himself, and his agenda

image.altText: A group of 8 people are standing in front of a table where two agreements are held up. they are standing outside

props.synopsis: A regional town in New South Wales is making history with a "momentous" partnership that embeds Closing the Gap targets into local government processes for the first time.

title.children: 'Historic' deal embeds Indigenous decision-making in local council

image.altText: A man with a beard stands in front of a stone facade.

props.synopsis: An Iranian refugee has lost a court battle against the federal government for mental health injuries caused by five years of immigration detention.

title.children: Refugee loses court battle over mental injuries caused by immigration detention

image.altText: NRL player sitting exhausted on the ground at the end of a rugby league match

image.altText: A gecko peeks out of the palm of someone's hands.

props.synopsis: New Caledonia's giant geckos are the latest sensation in the global pet trade. But conservationists warn their social media-fuelled popularity is putting the endangered species at risk.

title.children: The online gecko craze turning into a conservation nightmare

image.altText: An older man stands in front of rows of wine in a store.

props.synopsis: A mourner of grocer Linford Feick, who was fatally stabbed last month, was taken to hospital with an eye injury after being struck by a brick thrown from a moving car.

title.children: Slain NT grocer funeral guest hit by brick allegedly thrown at car

image.altText: An example ballot paper being filled out

props.synopsis: The results of a local council election in the City of Whittlesea in Melbourne's north have been voided, after suspicious votes were detected by authorities.

image.altText: Cassius montage

The world's best bodysurfers flocked to the Sunshine Coast to push the limits of the sport. Among them was Australian Olympic legend Susie O'Neill.

title.children: NT treasurer spends week before first budget at fishing comp

image.altText: Blonde-haired woman in blue jumper, in kitchen near pink orchid flower

title.children: Building watchdog to oversee repair of hundreds of defective homes

image.altText: A man holds a dog by the collar.

image.altText: A dog on leash walking down a hospital corridor.

props.synopsis: Dogs aren't what you'd expect to see when you step into an intensive care unit, but a study at the Canberra Hospital has found bringing therapy dogs onto the ward reduces anxiety and pain for critically ill patients.

title.children: Therapy dogs reducing pain and anxiety for intensive care patients

title.children: Dead little penguins wash up on multiple Eyre Peninsula beaches

image.altText: Suited choir gesture with arms while standing on steps
